headline: Leftover Mashed Potato Pancakes
description: Mashed potatoes can easily be turned into delicious potato pancakes covered in a crispy bread crumb crust - perfect use for any leftover mashed potatoes.
name: Leftover Mashed Potato Pancakes
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup dry bread crumbs, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine mashed potatoes, egg, and pepper in a bowl and mix well together.
Pour bread crumbs into a small bowl. Shape potato mixture into 3-inch patties with wet hands and dip in bread crumbs so they are evenly coated.
Heat oil and butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook potato cakes on both sides until they are heated through and browned, about 4 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: Ate these for dinner tonight and they were great. We doubled the recipe, left out the bread crumbs, and added 1/2 Tbsp. old bay, 2 Tbsp. bacon bits, and 1/4 cup chedder cheese.
I added saut√©ed diced veggies in and cooked on air fry with cooking spray on both sides

I only had panko breadcrumbs, added a little onion and cayenne. They were definitely better than regular reheated mashed potatoes. Our house doesn't really like leftovers, but using leftovers to create something else is a win. These with omelettes made with leftover ham were a hit. Thank you for the recipe.

Great "starter" recipe that can be made with whatever your taste buds are craving!
Ensure the breadcrumbs are pressed into the potatoes and oil is hot. 
My attempt produced a crunchy exterior and fluffy interior (I started with great tasting mash) and were served with a ration of bacon and fried eggs. Yummy
Very easy and good. I'm glad I tried it. I always check Allrecipes for recipes to make.
I give it 3 stars because we changed it up and added 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon onion powder. With our changes I would give it 4 stars.
I skipped the oil and butter and made it in my air fryer on the french fry setting. It was delicious.
Easy and delicious just as written. I can imagine many variations but if you want a simple and tasty recipe - this is it.

These were excellent. I added chopped onion, Lawrys, garlic powder, grated parmesan cheese, and cheddar cheese. They were pretty wet so I added some corn starch. 
 I used Italian bread crumbs because that's what I had. I'll always make more mashed potatoes than I need, just so I can make these again.
I added extra onion, cheese, garlic powder and coated in pankos. hey were pretty good but still lacking something

this the simplest, yet tasty way to refry potatoes! my family loves this way so much they request it for breakfast the next day! easy to make, and so versatile,,, i have added shredded cheese, chopped onions, bacon, garlic powder, even finely chopped ham, all are wonderful! thanks for the great recipe

I did make as written as not fair to rate a recipe that has been altered. Did not care for breadcrumbs. My grandmother always made potato pancakes, at least once each week, but used a tiny bit of flour on outside and then were served with sour cream or applesauce. Funnily enough, I just finished dinner and logged in to find this recipe. A friend just cooked something similar but he used ground pork and seasoned with salt, pepper, cumin, italian seasoning and a little tomato paste. Once pork was cooked he used leftover mashed, placed a good portion in hands and put pork in middle. Formed into a 2 inch ball, dipped in beaten egg and then in breadcrumbs and fried. Delish.
This was great - I never know what to do with leftover mashed potatoes cause they just don't taste that great reheated
I will make it again --i liked it with more onion .
